intro: Indigofera stenophylla var. nyassae, commonly known as the African indigo plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it valuable in agricultural settings. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
